Database

Class RealEstateDatabaseController

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.RealEstateDatabaseController

  • public class RealEstateDatabaseController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a wrapper for the SQL queries to the database for the RealEstate objects. It also creates objects of these classes and save the new object information to the database when a new Game is started.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Property> addAllRealEstatesToGame(int gameID)
      This creates a new set of RealEstate objects associated with the unique id key of a particular game, saves them to the database, and returns them in an ArrayList.
      boolean deleteAllGameRealEstates(int gameID)
      Deletes all of the RealEstate from the database that belong to the given game unique key id
      boolean doesPlayerHaveMonopoly(int ownerID, int numberForMonopoly, java.lang.String color)
      This is used to determine the player with the given unique id key owns the required number of the given RealEstate color set to qualify as a monopoly of that color.
      static RealEstateDatabaseController getInstance()
      Static function for the singleton design pattern, this is used by other classes instead of calling the constructor.
      RealEstate getRealEstateByID(int gameID, int spaceID)
      This gets the RealEstate from the database that corresponds to the unique id key combination.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getRents(int spaceID)
      This creates an ArrayList of rents for a given RealEstate unique id key spaceID from the database.
      boolean updateRealEstate(RealEstate realestate)
      This updates the database information for the given RealEstate.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RealEstateDatabaseController getInstance()
        Static function for the singleton design pattern, this is used by other classes instead of calling the constructor.
        Returns:
        RealEstateDatabaseController the existing instance, or a new object if no instance currently exists

      • getRealEstateByID

        public RealEstate getRealEstateByID(int gameID,
                                    int spaceID)
        This gets the RealEstate from the database that corresponds to the unique id key combination. If successful it returns a new RealEstate object with the data values belonging to that RealEstate, otherwise it returns a NULL RealEstate object.
        Parameters:
        gameID - the particular game this RealEstate belongs to
        spaceID - the space on the game board where this RealEstate is located
        Returns:
        RealEstate

      • getRents

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getRents(int spaceID)
        This creates an ArrayList of rents for a given RealEstate unique id key spaceID from the database. If not successful it returns a NULL ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        spaceID - the space location on the game board
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Integer rents

      • updateRealEstate

        public boolean updateRealEstate(RealEstate realestate)
        This updates the database information for the given RealEstate. Precondition: The RealEstate object to be saved to the database must already have been updated as needed, and exist in the database.
        Parameters:
        realestate - the RealEstate to update in the database
        Returns:
        boolean if successful returns true, otherwise it returns false

      • addAllRealEstatesToGame

        public java.util.ArrayList<Property> addAllRealEstatesToGame(int gameID)
        This creates a new set of RealEstate objects associated with the unique id key of a particular game, saves them to the database, and returns them in an ArrayList. If not successful it returns a NULL ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        gameID - the game id
        Returns:
        ArrayList of RealEstate Properties

      • doesPlayerHaveMonopoly

        public boolean doesPlayerHaveMonopoly(int ownerID,
                                      int numberForMonopoly,
                                      java.lang.String color)
        This is used to determine the player with the given unique id key owns the required number of the given RealEstate color set to qualify as a monopoly of that color. This is needed to calculate the rent for a RealEstate.
        Parameters:
        ownerID - the player's id
        numberForMonopoly - the number of real estate properties needed in that color to be a monopoly
        color - the color set being checked for a monopoly with that player owner
        Returns:
        boolean are both of the Utility owned by that player

      • deleteAllGameRealEstates

        public boolean deleteAllGameRealEstates(int gameID)
        Deletes all of the RealEstate from the database that belong to the given game unique key id
        Parameters:
        gameID - the game id in the database
        Returns:
        boolean returns true if successful, or false if not successful
